class_notes:
(Same as THEA 375R 1)
(Permission Required Prior to Enrollment)
Application required. Complete course atlas information (including texts and grading) and application form will be available on the Creative Writing Program website in MID-OCTOBER: https://creativewriting.emory.edu/index.html


Both accepted and waitlisted students are required to attend the first class.


Pre-requisite: ENGCW/THEA 372RW Playwriting (with a final grade of A- or A)
Writing sample required: 10 pages of dramatic writing


In a round-table setting, students will workshop their own work, critique their fellows' work, and delve into the art of playwriting and dramatic narrative, while reading and acting in each other's scenes, and reading published work. Writing and reading intensive.
course_description: Spring semester. Admittance by assessment of readiness for advanced work by intermediate level instructor in genre. Intensive workshop in the writing of playwriting for advanced students. May be repeated for a maximum of eight hours credit.
sections: Class Nbr: 4104, Section #: 1, Type: SEM, Campus: ATL, Meets: T 2:30-5:30p, Instructor: J. Skibell, Status: Open
